msContents.summary: Tax register, recording the daily collection of money taxes in the village of Karanis; the name of each tax-payer paying the poll-tax is cross-referenced with a page of another register, where taxpayers were listed geographically

msItemStruct.note: Due to the size of this tax roll (P.Mich. IV/1, 225 + IV/2, 358), its content has been divided in the present database into several cards (one for each column).
Pub. status: Recto; Verso of col. 134 is blank

supportDesc.support: 1 papyrus ; col. 133-134: 34.8 x 29.2 cm; total size: ***

condition.ab: Col. 135: nearly complete (papyrus cut off right of col. 134 when housed in glass)

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Horion son of Lupus and Ammonarion grandson of Horos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 248)
Petesouchos son of Hatres and Tapetheus grandson of Petheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 210)
Didymos son of Satabous and Tapetheus grandson of Pakysis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 162)
Anchophis son of Petaus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 149)
Sambas son of Euemeros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 223)
Satabous son of Phaesis and Philoumene grandson of Sarapion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 226)
Sokmenis son of Apynchis and Thatres grandson of Sambas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 230)
Hatres son of Apollonios and Taorsenouphis grandson of Heraklas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 156)
Ptollas son of Satabous and Tapondos grandson of Ptollas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 221)
Pamoneios (Pamonneouis) son of Anchorimphis and Didymarion grandson of Pamoneios (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 197)
Petermouthis son of Protas and Thermouthis g randson of Papondos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 210)
Hatres son of Phanomgeus and Tapetheus grandson of Heraklas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 157)
Menches son of Satabous and Tkonnos grandson of Maron (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 187)
Mysthes son of Patkonnis and Ptolema grandson of Harobros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 189)
Ptollis son of Akousilaos and Aphrodous grandson of Ptollis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 221)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: (Col.) 134;;(Pauni 30, continued);Horion, son of Lupus and Ammonarion, grandson of Horos: 16 drachmai 24 obols; column 91;Total for the day: 112 drachmai 25 obols.;;In Epeiph,;on the 1st:;Petesouchos, son of Hatres and Tapetheus, grandson of Petheus, for ch(--): 28 obols; column 82;Didymos, son of Satabous and Tapetheus, grandson of Pakysis, for ch(--): 8 drachmai; column 84;Anchophis, son of Petaus - (through) Kabinounis - for garden land of year 13: for apomoira, 5 drachmai 1/2 obol; for olive (transportation), 4 1/2 obols; for naubion, 3 obols 2 chalkoi; for supplements, 1 drachme 1 1/2 obols 2 chalkoi; for eparourion, 3 drachmai 2 1/2 obols; for supplements, 1 1/2 obols 2 chalkoi; for kollybos, 1 obol 2 chalkoi. Total: 11 drachmai 3 1/2 obols.;And on the account of Sambas, son of Euemeros, for garden land of year 13: for apomoira, 5 drachmai; for olive (transportation), 4 obols 2 chalkoi; for naubion, 3 obols; for supplements, 1 drachme 1 1/2 obols; for eparourion, 3 drachmai 2 obols; for supplements, 1 1/2 obols 2 chalkoi; for kollybos, 1 obol 2 chalkoi. Total: 11 drachmai 1 1/2 obols 2 chalkoi]. (In left margin:) 24 drachmai.;Satabous, son of Phaesis and Philoumene, grandson of Sarapion, for ch(--): 4 drachmai; column 93;Sokmenis, son of Apynchis and Thatres, grandson of Sambas: 12 drachmai; column 94;Hatres, son of Apollonios and Taorsenouphis, grandson of Heraklas: 4 drachmai; column 64;Ptollas, son of Satabous and Tapondos, grandson of Ptollas: 8 drachmai; column 97;Pamoneios, son of Anchorimphis and Didymarion, grandson of Pamoneios, for ch(--): 28 obols; column 98;Petermouthis, son of Protas and Thermouthis,g randson of Papondos: 12 drachmai; column 101;Hatres, son of Phanomgeus and Tapetheus, grandson of Heraklas, for ch(--): 4 drachmai; column 103;Total for the day: 80 drachmai 27 obols.;;On the 2nd, similarly:;Menches, son of Satabous and Tkonnos, grandson of Maron, for ch(--): 8 drachmai; column 5;Mysthes, son of Patkonnis and Ptolema, grandson of Harobros, for (the contribution for) the guards: 4 drachmai; column 7;Ptollis, son of Akousilaos and Aphrodous, grandson of Ptollis: 4 drachmai; column 11
